DOCNAME: CASE OF DRAGOSTEA COPIILOR - PETROVSCHI - NAGORNII v. MOLDOVA
JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Corneliu Bîrsan;Ján Šikuta;Josep Casadevall;Luis López Guerra;Mihai Poalelungi;Nona Tsotsoria
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant company , which runs a primary school in PERSON , was party to civil proceedings in DATE . By a judgment of ORG of DATE the applicant company was ordered to pay Mr M. CARDINAL,CARDINAL United States dollars .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date in DATE Mr PERSON applied to ORG for the enforcement of the judgment of DATE . However , his application was dismissed on the ground that it had been time - barred . In a letter dated CARDINAL DATE Mr M. was informed that no enforcement warrant in respect of the judgment of DATE had been lodged DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE Mr M. lodged a request with ORG asking for an extension of the DATE time - limit for requesting enforcement of the judgment in his favour . He argued , inter alia , that he had submitted a request for enforcement sometime in DATE together with the enforcement warrant , but that it had allegedly been lost by ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG finally dismissed PERSON request . It found , inter alia , that the enforcement of a judgment may be requested by an interested party to the proceedings within DATE from DATE when the judgment became final and enforceable . Since Mr M. had made such a formal request DATE after the judgment of DATE had become final , he had missed the deadline . The court found that Mr M. could not produce any plausible evidence justifying his missing the time - limit and could not prove his contention that he had submitted a request which had subsequently been lost by ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON lodged a request for review of the final judgment of DATE . He relied on LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) and argued that according to a letter dated DATE sent to him by ORG in reply to a letter from him , an enforcement warrant had been registered with ORG on DATE but had been returned to ORG DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused PERSON request for review because the ground relied on by him did not fall under LAW ( c ) of LAW , namely the letter from ORG had become known to him before the pronouncement of the judgment of DATE . Moreover , the enforcement warrant referred to in the letter of CARDINAL DATE did not concern the enforcement of the judgment of DATE but the enforcement of a surety ordered by the first - instance court DATE on which the judgment of DATE became enforceable . On DATE Mr M. lodged an appeal on points of law against this decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE a Judge PERSON was appointed rapporteur in the case .

CARDINAL . On DATE , a panel of CARDINAL judges of ORG allowed PERSON appeal , quashed the decision of CARDINAL DATE , granted PERSON request for review and ordered a fresh examination of the case . ORG considered the letter of CARDINAL DATE as a new document within the meaning of LAW ) of LAW and argued that PERSON could have obtained it DATE . The court did not dispute the lower court ’s findings to the effect that the enforcement warrant referred to in the letter of CARDINAL DATE did not concern the enforcement of the judgment of DATE but the enforcement of a surety ordered by the first - instance court . Judge PERSON , appointed rapporteur on DATE , did not participate in the examination of the appeal .
CARDINAL . The reopened proceedings ended with a final judgment of ORG of DATE in favour of PERSON resulting in the enforcement of the judgment of ORG of DATE against the applicant company .
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW concerning the review of final judgments read as follows :
“ A request for review shall be granted when :

( c ) after a judgment has been adopted , new documents have been discovered which were withheld by CARDINAL of the parties to the proceedings or which could not have been submitted to the court during the proceedings because of circumstances beyond the control of the interested party ;
A request for review may be lodged :
( d ) within DATE from the date on which the document was discovered DATE in cases concerning LAW ) ; ”
The relevant provisions of the PERSON on ORG read :
“ ( CARDINAL ) ORG , and ORG of ORG shall be headed by a president and a vice - president who shall have the following responsibilities :
( b ) ... distribute cases among the members of the ORG ... ”
The relevant part of LAW reads as follows :

“ The participation of the judge rapporteur in the examination of an appeal on points of law is obligatory . If the rapporteur is unable to participate , a new rapporteur should be appointed not DATE before the date of the examination of the appeal . ”
The relevant part of ORG reads :

“ ( CARDINAL ) The work of the judiciary must be carried out in accordance with the principle of random distribution of cases , except when a particular judge is prevented from participating in the examination of a case on objective grounds . ”
( CARDINAL ) Cases assigned to CARDINAL panel can not be assigned to another panel except within the limits of the law .
